bugs.title: CVE-2016-9939 cryptopp: DoS in ASN.1 parser due to octet processing [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-9939 cryptopp: DoS in ASN.1 parser due to octet processing [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-9939 cryptopp: DoS in ASN.1 parser due to octet processing

long_desc.thetext:
When Crypto++ library parses an ASN.1 data value, the library allocates for the content octets based on the length octets. Later, if there's too few or too little content octets, the library throws a BERDecodeErr exception. The memory for the content octets will be zeroized (even if unused), which could take a long time on a large allocation.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/weidai11/cryptopp/issues/346

References:

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/cryptopp-users/fEQ8jWg_K8g/qOLHGIDICwAJ

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q4/660

Created cryptopp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1404145]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1404146]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-9434 cryptopp: Out-of-bounds read in zinflate [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-9434 cryptopp: Out-of-bounds read in zinflate [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-9434 cryptopp: Out-of-bounds read in zinflate

long_desc.thetext:
Crypto++ (aka cryptopp) through 5.6.5 contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in zinflate.cpp in the Inflator filter.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/weidai11/cryptopp/issues/414

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/weidai11/cryptopp/commit/07dbcc3d9644b18e05c1776db2a57fe04d780965

Created cryptopp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1458791]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1458792]

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q2/419
